Class ncsa.hdf.object.H5Accessory 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----ncsa.hdf.object.H5Accessory
public final class H5Accessory
extends java.lang.Object
The H5Accessory class provides common static methods to HDF5 objects.

Version:
1.0 12/12/2001
Author:
Peter X. Cao, NCSA

H5Accessory()
 

allocateArray(int, int)
Allocate a one-dimensional array of byte, short, int, long, float, double, or String to store data retrieved from an HDF5 file based on the given HDF5 datatype and dimension sizes.
getAttribute(int)
Returns a list of attriubtes for the given object location.
getDatatypeDescription(int)
Returns the short description of datatype.
getLibversion()
Returns the version of the HDF5 library.
isUnsigned(int)
Checks if the datatype is an unsigned integer.
toNativeType(int)
Return the HDF5 native datatype based on the HDF5 datatype on disk

writeAttribute(int, Attribute, boolean)
Creates a new attribute and attached to the object if attribute does not exist.

H5Accessory
public H5Accessory()

getAttribute
public static java.util.List getAttribute(int objID) throws HDF5Exception
          Returns a list of attriubtes for the given object location.

Parameters:
objID - the object identifier.
writeAttribute
public static boolean writeAttribute(int objID,
                                     Attribute attr,
                                     boolean attrExisted) throws HDF5Exception
          Creates a new attribute and attached to the object if attribute does not exist. Otherwise, just update the value of the attribute.

Parameters:
objID - the object identifier.
attr - the atribute to attach.
attrExisted - The indicator if the given attribute exists.
Returns:
true if successful and false otherwise.
allocateArray
public static java.lang.Object allocateArray(int tid,
                                   int size)
          Allocate a one-dimensional array of byte, short, int, long, float, double, or String to store data retrieved from an HDF5 file based on the given HDF5 datatype and dimension sizes.

Parameters:
tid - the datatype.
size - the total size of the array.
Returns:
the array object if successful and null otherwise.
toNativeType
public static int toNativeType(int tid)
          Return the HDF5 native datatype based on the HDF5 datatype on disk

Parameters:
tid - the datatype on disk.
Returns:
the native datatype if successful and negative otherwise.
getDatatypeDescription
public static final java.lang.String getDatatypeDescription(int tid)
          Returns the short description of datatype.

Parameters:
tid - the data type.
isUnsigned
public static final boolean isUnsigned(int datatype)
          Checks if the datatype is an unsigned integer.

Parameters:
datatype - the data type.
Returns:
True is the datatype is an unsigned integer; otherwise returns false.
getLibversion
public static final java.lang.String getLibversion()
          Returns the version of the HDF5 library.
